preqs: Enrolled in Bachelor of Architectural Design and must have passed 96 credit points, OHS1000

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {3119%, 3120%}

description: This unit introduces aspects of architectural production. This unit covers architectural production in relation to a range of historical, theoretical, material and speculative domains addressing diverse social, cultural, technological, and communicative aspects of architecture. Explorations will incorporate various methodologies and points of view. The unit will help students develop analytical methods for understanding and contributing to the evolving built environment.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
